{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2009â10 |Prev year=2008â09 |Next year=2010â11 |Team=Old Dominion Monarchs |Image= ODU monarch logo.svg |Conference=Colonial Athletic Association |Division= |ShortConference=CAA |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=27â9 |ConfRecord=15â3 |HeadCoach=[[Blaine Taylor]] |AsstCoach1=Jim Corrigan |AsstCoach2=John Richardson |AsstCoach3=Robert Wilkes |StadiumArena=[[Ted Constant Convocation Center]] |Champion=CAA Regular Season Champions
CAA Tournament Champions |BowlTourney=[[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] |BowlTourneyResult=Second Round }} {{2009â10 CAA men's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 [[Old Dominion Monarchs men's basketball]] team''' represented [[Old Dominion University]] in the [[2009â10 NCAA Division I men's basketball season|2009â10]] [[college basketball]] season. This was head coach [[Blaine Taylor]]'s ninth season at Old Dominion. The Monarchs compete in the [[2009â10 Colonial Athletic Association men's basketball season|Colonial Athletic Association]] and played their home games at the [[Ted Constant Convocation Center]]. They finished the season 27â9, 15â3 in CAA play to win the regulars season championship. The also won the [[2010 CAA Men's Basketball Tournament]] to earn the CAA's automatic bid to the [[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]]. They earned a 11 seed in the South Region where they upset 6 seed [[2009â10 Notre Dame Fighting Irish men's basketball team|Notre Dame]] in the first round before losing to 3 seed and AP #19 [[2009â10 Baylor Bears men's basketball team|Baylor]] in the second round. ==Preseason== In the CAA preseason polls, released October 20 in [[Washington, DC]], Old Dominion was perdicted to finish first in the CAA.http://www.caasports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?SPSID=43048&SPID=3455&DB_OEM_ID=8500&ATCLID=204817269 Sr. C/F Gerald Lee was selected to the preseason all conference first team and was picked as the conference preseason co–player of the year with Hofstra's Charles Jenkins. Jr. G/F Ben Finney was a preseason conference honorable mention. ==Roster== {| style="border:5px solid #ADADB4;" cellspacing=3 |- align="center" bgcolor="#002B5F" |colspan=8|'''Monarch Men's Basketball'''
